result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie L Gillis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant has 2 days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Total fines and costs to be paid during the term of the probationary period.  Failure to pay will result in one day jail for each $25 owed for contempt of court.  $150 bail/bond previously posted is to be applied to the fines and costs of case 15CM0810.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

Defendant Ronnie L Gillis in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a guilty plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary.  Court finds the defendant guilty as to their plea.  Court renders judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Ronnie L Gillis in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requesting plea/sentencing date. Defendant to begin AODA treatment at the end of this month. Petition for bail modification heard. State objects to any modification. Court denies petition.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
